name: Huahin Manager
body:
## Huahin Manager Huahin Manager is Simple Management System for Hadoop MapReduce Job. Huahin can get a list of MapReduce jobs, get status, do a kill for the job. (Job queue management will be implemented in the future.) Huahin Manager is distributed under Apache License 2.0. ### Download [Huahin Manager 0.1.0](https://github.com/downloads/huahin/huahin-manager/huahin-manager-0.1.tar.gz)
### Requirements ``` Java 6+ ```
### Install Huahin Manager ``` ~ $ tar xzf huahin-manager-0.1.tar.gz ```
### Configure Huahin Manager Edit the huahin-manager-0.1/conf/huahinManager.properties file and set mapred.job.tracker property to the JobTracker URI. For example: ``` mapred.job.tracker=localhost:9001 ``` When you change the boot port, edit the huahin-manager-0.1/conf/port file.
### Start/Stop Huahin Manager To start/stop Huahin Manager use Huahin Manager's bin/manager script. For example: ``` $ bin/manager start ```
### Test Huahin Manager is working ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list" [ { "jobid": "job_201205111223_0001", "mapComplete": "100.0%", "name": "JOB_EBCF7626A41F34B4C7276DB2B152336F", "priority": "NORMAL", "reduceComplete": "100.0%", "schedulingInfo": "NA", "startTime": "Fri May 11 12:25:18 JST 2012", "state": "SUCCEEDED", "user": "huahin" } ] ```
### Huahin Manager REST APIs Get all job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list" ```
Get failed job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/failed" ```
Get killed job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/killed" ```
Get prep job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/prep" ```
Get running job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/running" ```
Get succeeded job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/succeeded" ```
Get job status. {JOBID} specifies the jobid. ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/status/{JOBID}" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/status/job_201205111223_0001" ```
Kill job for ID. {JOBID} specifies the job ID. ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/id/{JOBID}" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/id/job_201205111223_0001" ```
Kill job for job name. {JOBNAME} specifies the job name. ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/name/{JOBNAME}" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/name/WORD_COUNT_JOB" ```
### Support or Contact Contact huahin-framework@googlegroups.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
tagline: Simple Management System for Hadoop MapReduce Job.
